awd_titl_txt: Laboratory Investigation of Particle Acceleration Process   by Ion Acoustic Double Layers
awd_abstract_narration: One of the key scientific issues of contemporary                           magnetospheric physics is to elucidate the processes that are                   responsible for particle acceleration in the auroral region.                    Acceleration of the particles along a magnetic field requires the               action of an electric field which can either be an extended                     structure or confined to a shock-like structure in a narrow                     region called a double layer.  This grant is to extend previous                 laboratory investigations of ion acoustic double layers to a                    plasma parameter regime that is useful for understanding auroral                particle acceleration.  The experiments consist of creating a                   series of ion acoustic double layers in a long magnetized plasma                column and studying the acceleration of both ambient and test                   particles across them.
org_div_long_name: Division of Atmospheric and Geospace Sciences
